title: What is the most common method for repairing nucleotide errors in DNA? - Quora

response.answer_text: The majority of DNA nucleotide errors are solved by the cells itself via efficient detection and resolution mechanism underlying the DNA Damage Response (DDR) error during the DNA replication. This are solved by the so called Mismatch Repair (MMR) pathwaynucleotide cross linking resulting from exposure to UV light for example are resolved via the Nucleotide Excision Repair (NER ) pathwaynucleotide base modification resulting for example from the exposure to reactive oxygen species (ROS) are handled by the Base Excision Repair (BER ) pathway
